body_html:
The best bet is to build it in theRelease or RelWithDebInfo configurations, which are the only two we support. (Debug has some compatibility issues with the behavior of STL iterators in MSVC... and apparently some image-size problems too!)

I've just sent out PR #5532, which adds the CPU version of avgpooling_op.cc to the Windows build, and the tests are passing.
body_text:
The best bet is to build it in theRelease or RelWithDebInfo configurations, which are the only two we support. (Debug has some compatibility issues with the behavior of STL iterators in MSVC... and apparently some image-size problems too!)
I've just sent out PR #5532, which adds the CPU version of avgpooling_op.cc to the Windows build, and the tests are passing.
body:
The best bet is to build it in the`Release` or `RelWithDebInfo` configurations, which are the only two we support. (`Debug` has some compatibility issues with the behavior of STL iterators in MSVC... and apparently some image-size problems too!)

I've just sent out PR #5532, which adds the CPU version of `avgpooling_op.cc` to the Windows build, and the tests are passing.
